name: aharper
cooked: There must be a few choices, though I would not call it a spectrum. Where a project is as open as it can be without violating the laws of the land (export controls and perhaps other regulations come to mind), it still should be recognized as open, but only to a limited audience (US citizens in the export control example). There should be a definition and certification process which honors the efforts, but makes it clear that through no fault of the author, the project is not available to all.
raw: There must be a few choices, though I would not call it a spectrum.  Where a project is as open as it can be without violating the laws of the land (export controls and perhaps other regulations come to mind), it still should be recognized as open, but only to a limited audience (US citizens in the export control example).  There should be a definition and certification process which honors the efforts, but makes it clear that through no fault of the author, the project is not available to all.
